00066 static char rawbuf[8192];
00067 static char *buf = rawbuf;
00068 static int max = 8192;

00070 static int subsystem_mask = ~0;
00071 static int debug_mask = ~0;

00073 #define MAX_MARK_SIZE 256

00075 static const char *libcfs_debug_subsystems[] = LIBCFS_DEBUG_SUBSYS_NAMES;
00076 static const char *libcfs_debug_masks[] = LIBCFS_DEBUG_MASKS_NAMES;

00078 #define DAEMON_CTL_NAME         "daemon_file"

00080 #define DEBUG_CTL_NAME          "debug"

00083 /*
00084  * Open the parameter file "debug" which controls the debugging
00085  * flags used to determine what information ends up in the lustre
00086  * logs collected by lctl dk or the debug daemon.
00087  */
00088 static int
00089 dbg_open_ctlhandle(const char *str)
00090 {
00091         glob_t path;
00092         int fd, rc;
00093 
00094         rc = cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "%s", str);
00095         if (rc != 0) {
00096                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid parameter '%s'\n", str);
00097                 return -1;
00098         }
00099 
00100         fd = open(path.gl_pathv[0], O_WRONLY);
00101         if (fd < 0)
00102                 fprintf(stderr, "open '%s' failed: %s\n",
00103                         path.gl_pathv[0], strerror(errno));
00104 
00105         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00106         return fd;
00107 }
00108 
00109 static void
00110 dbg_close_ctlhandle(int fd)
00111 {
00112         close(fd);
00113 }
00114 
00115 static int
00116 dbg_write_cmd(int fd, char *str, int len)
00117 {
00118         int rc = write(fd, str, len);
00119 
00120         return (rc == len ? 0 : 1);
00121 }

00123 
00124 static int do_debug_mask(char *name, int enable)
00125 {
00126         int found = 0;
00127         int i;
00128 
00129         for (i = 0; libcfs_debug_subsystems[i] != NULL; i++) {
00130                 if (strcasecmp(name, libcfs_debug_subsystems[i]) == 0 ||
00131                     strcasecmp(name, "all_subs") == 0) {
00132                         printf("%s output from subsystem \"%s\"\n",
00133                                 enable ? "Enabling" : "Disabling",
00134                                 libcfs_debug_subsystems[i]);
00135                         if (enable)
00136                                 subsystem_mask |= (1 << i);
00137                         else
00138                                 subsystem_mask &= ~(1 << i);
00139                         found = 1;
00140                 }
00141         }
00142         for (i = 0; libcfs_debug_masks[i] != NULL; i++) {
00143                 if (strcasecmp(name, libcfs_debug_masks[i]) == 0 ||
00144                     strcasecmp(name, "all_types") == 0) {
00145                         printf("%s output of type \"%s\"\n",
00146                                 enable ? "Enabling" : "Disabling",
00147                                 libcfs_debug_masks[i]);
00148                         if (enable)
00149                                 debug_mask |= (1 << i);
00150                         else
00151                                 debug_mask &= ~(1 << i);
00152                         found = 1;
00153                 }
00154         }
00155 
00156         return found;
00157 }

00159 int dbg_initialize(int argc, char **argv)
00160 {
00161         return 0;
00162 }

00164 int jt_dbg_filter(int argc, char **argv)
00165 {
00166         int i;
00167 
00168         if (argc < 2) {
00169                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <subsystem ID or debug mask>\n",
00170                         argv[0]);
00171                 return 0;
00172         }
00173 
00174         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++)
00175                 if (!do_debug_mask(argv[i], 0))
00176                         fprintf(stderr, "Unknown subsystem or debug type: %s\n",
00177                                 argv[i]);
00178         return 0;
00179 }
00180 
00181 int jt_dbg_show(int argc, char **argv)
00182 {
00183         int i;
00184 
00185         if (argc < 2) {
00186                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <subsystem ID or debug mask>\n",
00187                         argv[0]);
00188                 return 0;
00189         }
00190 
00191         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++)
00192                 if (!do_debug_mask(argv[i], 1))
00193                         fprintf(stderr, "Unknown subsystem or debug type: %s\n",
00194                                 argv[i]);
00195 
00196         return 0;
00197 }
00198 
00199 static int applymask(char *param, int value)
00200 {
00201         int     rc;
00202         char    buf[64];
00203         int     len = snprintf(buf, 64, "%d", value);
00204 
00205         int fd = dbg_open_ctlhandle(param);
00206         if (fd < 0)
00207                 return fd;
00208 
00209         rc = dbg_write_cmd(fd, buf, len+1);
00210         if (rc != 0) {
00211                 fprintf(stderr, "Write to %s failed: %s\n",
00212                         param, strerror(errno));
00213         }
00214 
00215         dbg_close_ctlhandle(fd);
00216 
00217         return rc;
00218 }
00219 
00220 static void applymask_all(unsigned int subs_mask, unsigned int debug_mask)
00221 {
00222         applymask(SUBSYS_DEBUG_CTL_NAME, subs_mask);
00223         applymask(DEBUG_CTL_NAME, debug_mask);
00224         printf("Applied subsystem_debug=%d, debug=%d to lnet\n",
00225                subs_mask, debug_mask);
00226 }
00227 
00228 int jt_dbg_list(int argc, char **argv)
00229 {
00230         int i;
00231 
00232         if (argc != 2) {
00233                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <subs || types>\n", argv[0]);
00234                 return 0;
00235         }
00236 
00237         if (strcasecmp(argv[1], "subs") == 0) {
00238                 printf("Subsystems: all_subs");
00239                 for (i = 0; libcfs_debug_subsystems[i] != NULL; i++)
00240                         if (libcfs_debug_subsystems[i][0])
00241                                 printf(", %s", libcfs_debug_subsystems[i]);
00242                 printf("\n");
00243         } else if (strcasecmp(argv[1], "types") == 0) {
00244                 printf("Types: all_types");
00245                 for (i = 0; libcfs_debug_masks[i] != NULL; i++)
00246                         printf(", %s", libcfs_debug_masks[i]);
00247                 printf("\n");
00248         } else if (strcasecmp(argv[1], "applymasks") == 0) {
00249                 applymask_all(subsystem_mask, debug_mask);
00250         }
00251         return 0;
00252 }
00253 
00254 /* all strings nul-terminated; only the struct and hdr need to be freed */
00255 struct dbg_line {
00256         struct ptldebug_header *hdr;
00257         char                   *file;
00258         char                   *fn;
00259         char                   *text;
00260 };
00261 
00262 static int cmp_rec(const void *p1, const void *p2)
00263 {
00264         struct dbg_line *d1 = *(struct dbg_line **)p1;
00265         struct dbg_line *d2 = *(struct dbg_line **)p2;
00266 
00267         if (d1->hdr->ph_sec < d2->hdr->ph_sec)
00268                 return -1;
00269         if (d1->hdr->ph_sec == d2->hdr->ph_sec &&
00270             d1->hdr->ph_usec < d2->hdr->ph_usec)
00271                 return -1;
00272         if (d1->hdr->ph_sec == d2->hdr->ph_sec &&
00273             d1->hdr->ph_usec == d2->hdr->ph_usec)
00274                 return 0;
00275         return 1;
00276 }
00277 
00278 static void print_rec(struct dbg_line ***linevp, int used, int fdout)
00279 {
00280         struct dbg_line **linev = *linevp;
00281         int               i;
00282 
00283         qsort(linev, used, sizeof(struct dbg_line *), cmp_rec);
00284         for (i = 0; i < used; i++) {
00285                 struct dbg_line         *line = linev[i];
00286                 struct ptldebug_header  *hdr = line->hdr;
00287                 char                     out[4097];
00288                 char                    *buf = out;
00289                 int                      bytes;
00290                 ssize_t                  bytes_written;
00291 
00292                 bytes = snprintf(out, sizeof(out),
00293                                 "%08x:%08x:%u.%u%s:%u.%06llu:%u:%u:%u:"
00294                                 "(%s:%u:%s()) %s",
00295                                 hdr->ph_subsys, hdr->ph_mask,
00296                                 hdr->ph_cpu_id, hdr->ph_type,
00297                                 hdr->ph_flags & PH_FLAG_FIRST_RECORD ? "F" : "",
00298                                 hdr->ph_sec, (unsigned long long)hdr->ph_usec,
00299                                 hdr->ph_stack, hdr->ph_pid, hdr->ph_extern_pid,
00300                                 line->file, hdr->ph_line_num, line->fn,
00301                                 line->text);
00302                 while (bytes > 0) {
00303                         bytes_written = write(fdout, buf, bytes);
00304                         if (bytes_written <= 0)
00305                                 break;
00306                         bytes -= bytes_written;
00307                         buf += bytes_written;
00308                 }
00309                 free(line->hdr);
00310                 free(line);
00311         }
00312         free(linev);
00313         *linevp = NULL;
00314 }
00315 
00316 static int add_rec(struct dbg_line *line, struct dbg_line ***linevp, int *lenp,
00317                    int used)
00318 {
00319         struct dbg_line **linev = *linevp;
00320 
00321         if (used == *lenp) {
00322                 int nlen = *lenp + 4096;
00323                 int nsize = nlen * sizeof(struct dbg_line *);
00324 
00325                 linev = realloc(*linevp, nsize);
00326                 if (!linev)
00327                         return -ENOMEM;
00328 
00329                 *linevp = linev;
00330                 *lenp = nlen;
00331         }
00332         linev[used] = line;
00333 
00334         return 0;
00335 }
00336 
00337 static void dump_hdr(unsigned long long offset, struct ptldebug_header *hdr)
00338 {
00339         fprintf(stderr, "badly-formed record at offset = %llu\n", offset);
00340         fprintf(stderr, "  len = %u\n", hdr->ph_len);
00341         fprintf(stderr, "  flags = %x\n", hdr->ph_flags);
00342         fprintf(stderr, "  subsystem = %x\n", hdr->ph_subsys);
00343         fprintf(stderr, "  mask = %x\n", hdr->ph_mask);
00344         fprintf(stderr, "  cpu_id = %u\n", hdr->ph_cpu_id);
00345         fprintf(stderr, "  type = %u\n", hdr->ph_type);
00346         fprintf(stderr, "  seconds = %u\n", hdr->ph_sec);
00347         fprintf(stderr, "  microseconds = %lu\n", (long)hdr->ph_usec);
00348         fprintf(stderr, "  stack = %u\n", hdr->ph_stack);
00349         fprintf(stderr, "  pid = %u\n", hdr->ph_pid);
00350         fprintf(stderr, "  host pid = %u\n", hdr->ph_extern_pid);
00351         fprintf(stderr, "  line number = %u\n", hdr->ph_line_num);
00352 }
00353 
00354 #define HDR_SIZE sizeof(*hdr)
00355 
00356 static int parse_buffer(int fdin, int fdout)
00357 {
00358         struct dbg_line         *line;
00359         struct ptldebug_header  *hdr;
00360         char                     buf[4097];
00361         char                    *ptr;
00362         unsigned long            dropped = 0;
00363         unsigned long            kept = 0;
00364         unsigned long            bad = 0;
00365         struct dbg_line         **linev = NULL;
00366         int                      linev_len = 0;
00367         int                      rc;
00368 
00369         hdr = (void *)buf;
00370 
00371         while (1) {
00372                 int first_bad = 1;
00373                 int count;
00374 
00375                 count = HDR_SIZE;
00376                 ptr = buf;
00377 readhdr:
00378                 rc = read(fdin, ptr, count);
00379                 if (rc <= 0)
00380                         goto print;
00381 
00382                 ptr += rc;
00383                 count -= rc;
00384                 if (count > 0)
00385                         goto readhdr;
00386 
00387                 if (hdr->ph_len > 4094 ||       /* is this header bogus? */
00388                     hdr->ph_stack > 65536 ||
00389                     hdr->ph_sec < (1 << 30) ||
00390                     hdr->ph_usec > 1000000000 ||
00391                     hdr->ph_line_num > 65536) {
00392                         if (first_bad)
00393                                 dump_hdr(lseek(fdin, 0, SEEK_CUR), hdr);
00394                         bad += first_bad;
00395                         first_bad = 0;
00396 
00397                         /* try to restart on next line */
00398                         while (count < HDR_SIZE && buf[count] != '\n')
00399                                 count++;
00400                         if (buf[count] == '\n')
00401                                 count++; /* move past '\n' */
00402                         if (HDR_SIZE - count > 0) {
00403                                 int left = HDR_SIZE - count;
00404 
00405                                 memmove(buf, buf + count, left);
00406                                 ptr = buf + left;
00407 
00408                                 goto readhdr;
00409                         }
00410 
00411                         continue;
00412                 }
00413 
00414                 if (hdr->ph_len == 0)
00415                         continue;
00416 
00417                 count = hdr->ph_len - HDR_SIZE;
00418 readmore:
00419                 rc = read(fdin, ptr, count);
00420                 if (rc <= 0)
00421                         break;
00422 
00423                 ptr += rc;
00424                 count -= rc;
00425                 if (count > 0)
00426                         goto readmore;
00427 
00428                 first_bad = 1;
00429 
00430                 if ((hdr->ph_subsys && !(subsystem_mask & hdr->ph_subsys)) ||
00431                     (hdr->ph_mask && !(debug_mask & hdr->ph_mask))) {
00432                         dropped++;
00433                         continue;
00434                 }
00435 
00436 retry_alloc:
00437                 line = malloc(sizeof(*line));
00438                 if (line == NULL) {
00439                         if (linev) {
00440                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: line malloc(%u): "
00441                                         "printing accumulated records\n",
00442                                         (unsigned int)sizeof(*line));
00443                                 print_rec(&linev, kept, fdout);
00444 
00445                                 goto retry_alloc;
00446                         }
00447                         fprintf(stderr, "error: line malloc(%u): exiting\n",
00448                                 (unsigned int)sizeof(*line));
00449                         break;
00450                 }
00451 
00452                 line->hdr = malloc(hdr->ph_len + 1);
00453                 if (line->hdr == NULL) {
00454                         free(line);
00455                         if (linev) {
00456                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: hdr malloc(%u): "
00457                                         "printing accumulated records\n",
00458                                         hdr->ph_len + 1);
00459                                 print_rec(&linev, kept, fdout);
00460 
00461                                 goto retry_alloc;
00462                         }
00463                         fprintf(stderr, "error: hdr malloc(%u): exiting\n",
00464                                         hdr->ph_len + 1);
00465                         break;
00466                 }
00467 
00468                 ptr = (void *)line->hdr;
00469                 memcpy(line->hdr, buf, hdr->ph_len);
00470                 ptr[hdr->ph_len] = '\0';
00471 
00472                 ptr += sizeof(*hdr);
00473                 line->file = ptr;
00474                 ptr += strlen(line->file) + 1;
00475                 line->fn = ptr;
00476                 ptr += strlen(line->fn) + 1;
00477                 line->text = ptr;
00478 
00479 retry_add:
00480                 if (add_rec(line, &linev, &linev_len, kept) < 0) {
00481                         if (linev) {
00482                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: add_rec[%u] failed; "
00483                                         "print accumulated records\n",
00484                                         linev_len);
00485                                 print_rec(&linev, kept, fdout);
00486 
00487                                 goto retry_add;
00488                         }
00489                         fprintf(stderr, "error: add_rec[0] failed; exiting\n");
00490                         break;
00491                 }
00492                 kept++;
00493         }
00494 
00495 print:
00496         if (linev)
00497                 print_rec(&linev, kept, fdout);
00498 
00499         printf("Debug log: %lu lines, %lu kept, %lu dropped, %lu bad.\n",
00500                 dropped + kept + bad, kept, dropped, bad);
00501 
00502         return 0;
00503 }
00504 
00505 int jt_dbg_debug_kernel(int argc, char **argv)
00506 {
00507         struct stat     st;
00508         char            filename[PATH_MAX];
00509         int             raw = 0;
00510         int             save_errno;
00511         int             fdin;
00512         int             fdout;
00513         int             rc;
00514 
00515         if (argc > 3) {
00516                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [file] [raw]\n", argv[0]);
00517                 return 0;
00518         }
00519 
00520         if (argc > 2) {
00521                 raw = atoi(argv[2]);
00522         } else if (argc > 1 && (argv[1][0] == '0' || argv[1][0] == '1')) {
00523                 raw = atoi(argv[1]);
00524                 argc--;
00525         }
00526 
00527         /* If we are dumping raw (which means no conversion step to ASCII)
00528          * then dump directly to any supplied filename, otherwise this is
00529          * just a temp file and we dump to the real file at convert time. */
00530         if (argc > 1 && raw) {
00531                 if (strlen(argv[1]) >= sizeof(filename)) {
00532                         fprintf(stderr, "File name too long: %s\n", argv[1]);
00533                         return 1;
00534                 }
00535                 strncpy(filename, argv[1], sizeof(filename));
00536         } else {
00537                 if (snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s%lu.%u",
00538                              LIBCFS_DEBUG_FILE_PATH_DEFAULT, time(NULL),
00539                              getpid())
00540                     >= sizeof(filename)) {
00541                         fprintf(stderr, "File name too long\n");
00542                         return 1;
00543                 }
00544         }
00545 
00546         if (stat(filename, &st) == 0 && S_ISREG(st.st_mode))
00547                 unlink(filename);
00548 
00549         fdin = dbg_open_ctlhandle(DUMP_KERNEL_CTL_NAME);
00550         if (fdin < 0) {
00551                 fprintf(stderr, "open(dump_kernel) failed: %s\n",
00552                         strerror(errno));
00553                 return 1;
00554         }
00555 
00556         rc = dbg_write_cmd(fdin, filename, strlen(filename));
00557         save_errno = errno;
00558         dbg_close_ctlhandle(fdin);
00559         if (rc != 0) {
00560                 fprintf(stderr, "write(%s) failed: %s\n", filename,
00561                         strerror(save_errno));
00562                 return 1;
00563         }
00564 
00565         if (raw)
00566                 return 0;
00567 
00568         fdin = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
00569         if (fdin < 0) {
00570                 if (errno == ENOENT) /* no dump file created */
00571                         return 0;
00572                 fprintf(stderr, "fopen(%s) failed: %s\n", filename,
00573                         strerror(errno));
00574                 return 1;
00575         }
00576         if (argc > 1) {
00577                 fdout = open(argv[1], O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC,
00578                              S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
00579                 if (fdout < 0) {
00580                         fprintf(stderr, "fopen(%s) failed: %s\n", argv[1],
00581                                 strerror(errno));
00582                         close(fdin);
00583                         return 1;
00584                 }
00585         } else {
00586                 fdout = fileno(stdout);
00587         }
00588 
00589         rc = parse_buffer(fdin, fdout);
00590         close(fdin);
00591         if (argc > 1)
00592                 close(fdout);
00593         if (rc) {
00594                 fprintf(stderr, "parse_buffer failed; leaving tmp file %s "
00595                         "behind.\n", filename);
00596         } else {
00597                 rc = unlink(filename);
00598                 if (rc)
00599                         fprintf(stderr, "dumped successfully, but couldn't "
00600                                 "unlink tmp file %s: %s\n", filename,
00601                                 strerror(errno));
00602         }
00603 
00604         return rc;
00605 }
00606 
00607 int jt_dbg_debug_file(int argc, char **argv)
00608 {
00609         int fdin;
00610         int fdout;
00611         int rc;
00612 
00613         if (argc > 3 || argc < 2) {
00614                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <input> [output]\n", argv[0]);
00615                 return 0;
00616         }
00617 
00618         fdin = open(argv[1], O_RDONLY | O_LARGEFILE);
00619         if (fdin < 0) {
00620                 fprintf(stderr, "open(%s) failed: %s\n", argv[1],
00621                         strerror(errno));
00622                 return 1;
00623         }
00624         if (argc > 2) {
00625                 fdout = open(argv[2],
00626                              O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_WRONLY | O_LARGEFILE,
00627                              0600);
00628                 if (fdout < 0) {
00629                         fprintf(stderr, "open(%s) failed: %s\n", argv[2],
00630                                 strerror(errno));
00631                         close(fdin);
00632                         return 1;
00633                 }
00634         } else {
00635                 fdout = fileno(stdout);
00636         }
00637 
00638         rc = parse_buffer(fdin, fdout);
00639 
00640         close(fdin);
00641         if (fdout != fileno(stdout))
00642                 close(fdout);
00643 
00644         return rc;
00645 }
00646 
00647 const char debug_daemon_usage[] = "usage: %s {start file [MB]|stop}\n";
00648 
00649 int jt_dbg_debug_daemon(int argc, char **argv)
00650 {
00651         int rc;
00652         int fd;
00653 
00654         if (argc <= 1) {
00655                 fprintf(stderr, debug_daemon_usage, argv[0]);
00656                 return 1;
00657         }
00658 
00659         fd = dbg_open_ctlhandle(DAEMON_CTL_NAME);
00660         if (fd < 0)
00661                 return -1;
00662 
00663         rc = -1;
00664         if (strcasecmp(argv[1], "start") == 0) {
00665                 if (argc < 3 || argc > 4 ||
00666                     (argc == 4 && strlen(argv[3]) > 5)) {
00667                         fprintf(stderr, debug_daemon_usage, argv[0]);
00668                         goto out;
00669                 }
00670                 if (argc == 4) {
00671                         char             buf[12];
00672                         const long       min_size = 10;
00673                         const long       max_size = 20480;
00674                         long             size;
00675                         char            *end;
00676 
00677                         size = strtoul(argv[3], &end, 0);
00678                         if (size < min_size ||
00679                             size > max_size ||
00680                             *end != 0) {
00681                                 fprintf(stderr, "size %s invalid, must be in "
00682                                         "the range %ld-%ld MB\n", argv[3],
00683                                         min_size, max_size);
00684                                 goto out;
00685                         }
00686                         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "size=%ld", size);
00687                         rc = dbg_write_cmd(fd, buf, strlen(buf));
00688 
00689                         if (rc != 0) {
00690                                 fprintf(stderr, "set %s failed: %s\n",
00691                                         buf, strerror(errno));
00692                                 goto out;
00693                         }
00694                 }
00695 
00696                 rc = dbg_write_cmd(fd, argv[2], strlen(argv[2]));
00697                 if (rc != 0) {
00698                         fprintf(stderr, "start debug_daemon on %s failed: %s\n",
00699                                 argv[2], strerror(errno));
00700                         goto out;
00701                 }
00702                 rc = 0;
00703                 goto out;
00704         }
00705         if (strcasecmp(argv[1], "stop") == 0) {
00706                 rc = dbg_write_cmd(fd, "stop", 4);
00707                 if (rc != 0) {
00708                         fprintf(stderr, "stopping debug_daemon failed: %s\n",
00709                                 strerror(errno));
00710                         goto out;
00711                 }
00712 
00713                 rc = 0;
00714                 goto out;
00715         }
00716 
00717         fprintf(stderr, debug_daemon_usage, argv[0]);
00718         rc = -1;
00719 out:
00720         dbg_close_ctlhandle(fd);
00721         return rc;
00722 }
00723 
00724 int jt_dbg_clear_debug_buf(int argc, char **argv)
00725 {
00726         int                      rc;
00727         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00728 
00729         if (argc != 1) {
00730                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s\n", argv[0]);
00731                 return 0;
00732         }
00733 
00734         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00735         if (libcfs_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, max) != 0) {
00736                 fprintf(stderr, "libcfs_ioctl_pack failed.\n");
00737                 return -1;
00738         }
00739 
00740         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_CLEAR_DEBUG, buf);
00741         if (rc) {
00742                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_CLEAR_DEBUG failed: %s\n",
00743                         strerror(errno));
00744                 return -1;
00745         }
00746         return 0;
00747 }
00748 
00749 int jt_dbg_mark_debug_buf(int argc, char **argv)
00750 {
00751         static char              scratch[MAX_MARK_SIZE] = "";
00752         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00753         char                    *text;
00754         int                      rc;
00755 
00756         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00757 
00758         if (argc > 1) {
00759                 int count, max_size = sizeof(scratch) - 1;
00760 
00761                 strncpy(scratch, argv[1], max_size);
00762                 max_size -= strlen(argv[1]);
00763                 for (count = 2; (count < argc) && (max_size > 1); count++) {
00764                         strncat(scratch, " ", max_size);
00765                         max_size -= 1;
00766                         strncat(scratch, argv[count], max_size);
00767                         max_size -= strlen(argv[count]);
00768                 }
00769                 scratch[sizeof(scratch) - 1] = '\0';
00770                 text = scratch;
00771         } else {
00772                 time_t now = time(NULL);
00773                 text = ctime(&now);
00774         }
00775 
00776         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(text) + 1;
00777         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = text;
00778 
00779         if (libcfs_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, max) != 0) {
00780                 fprintf(stderr, "libcfs_ioctl_pack failed.\n");
00781                 return -1;
00782         }
00783 
00784         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_MARK_DEBUG, buf);
00785         if (rc) {
00786                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_MARK_DEBUG failed: %s\n",
00787                         strerror(errno));
00788                 return -1;
00789         }
00790         return 0;
00791 }

00833 
00834 int jt_dbg_modules(int argc, char **argv)
00835 {
00836         struct mod_paths *mp;
00837         char             *path = "";
00838         const char       *proc = "/proc/modules";
00839         char              modname[128];
00840         char              buf[4096];
00841         unsigned long     modaddr;
00842         FILE             *file;
00843 
00844         if (argc >= 2)
00845                 path = argv[1];
00846         if (argc > 3) {
00847                 printf("%s [path] [kernel]\n", argv[0]);
00848                 return 0;
00849         }
00850 
00851         file = fopen(proc, "r");
00852         if (!file) {
00853                 printf("failed open %s: %s\n", proc, strerror(errno));
00854                 return 0;
00855         }
00856 
00857         while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), file) != NULL) {
00858                 if (sscanf(buf, "%s %*s %*s %*s %*s %lx",
00859                            modname, &modaddr) == 2) {
00860                         for (mp = mod_paths; mp->name != NULL; mp++) {
00861                                 if (!strcmp(mp->name, modname))
00862                                         break;
00863                         }
00864                         if (mp->name) {
00865                                 printf("add-symbol-file %s%s%s/%s.o 0x%0lx\n",
00866                                         path, path[0] ? "/" : "",
00867                                         mp->path, mp->name, modaddr);
00868                         }
00869                 }
00870         }
00871 
00872         fclose(file);
00873         return 0;
00874 }
